translated: Translation: Record of the Three Treasures Throughout the Successive Reigns, Volume 9, on Translated Scriptures, Western Qin, Northern Liang, Yuan Wei, Gao Qi, Chen Dynasty
Submitted by the Imperial Secretary for Translation of Scriptures, Feilong, in the 17th year of the Kaihuang era

The five records of the Western Qin, Northern Liang, Wei, Qi, and Chen dynasties. This is also a matter of taking advantage of the times to save the world and benefit the people by spreading the teachings.
They are rulers who spread the teachings.
Qifu Guoren, a Xiongnu from Longxi,
Lived in Yuanguan and was the Shan Yu of the Southern Xiongnu.
After the defeat of the Former Qin, he proclaimed himself King of Qin.
He still had his capital in Zicheng.
He revered and served monks.
At that time, he encountered the holy Jian, who spread the teachings and reached there.
Guoren added to his respect and the treatment was very generous.
Having spread the teachings of ÅšÄkyamuni, he also ordered translations.
They passed on the throne to five rulers for forty-four years.
They were destroyed by the Xia.
Wei then swallowed the Xia.ğŸ”½Juqu Mengxun, a Ruru from Lincong,
Was the Left Juqu of the Xiongnu.
He took the surname of the official position and relied on the previous Liang dynasty.
He then established himself.
He moved the capital to Guzang.
He met with Dharma Master Dharmaká¹£ema, who translated the MahÄparinirvÄá¹‡a SÅ«tra and the MahÄsaá¹ƒnipÄta SÅ«tra, etc.
For two rulers, forty-three years.
It was destroyed by Wei.
Tuoba Gui, whose courtesy name was Shegao.
The captives of Wuyuan in Yunzhong became the Protector-General of Qin.
After the fall of the Fu clan, he finally took the title of Wei and made Heng the capital.
Up to the third ruler, Emperor Taiwu of Wei, Fu Ling.
In his time, he believed in and accepted heretical teachings.
He destroyed Buddhism, killed monks, and destroyed temples.
For seven years, he suffered from a serious illness and died.
After his death, it was restored.
The four rulers were in the north.
Up to Emperor Xiaowen of the Wei dynasty.
He moved the capital to Luoyang.
He changed his surname to Yuan.
He began to wear the crown and cap.
Up to the first year of Xiping of Emperor Xiaoming of the Wei dynasty.
Empress Dowager Hu of the Wei dynasty built Yongning Temple and erected a nine-story wooden pagoda.
It was ninety zhang tall.
Above it, there was a jeweled palace ten zhang high.
It was a thousand chi away from the ground.
If one was a hundred li away from the capital, one could see it from afar.
When they first wanted to build the foundation, they dug down to the yellow spring and found thirty-two golden statues.
The Empress Dowager believed it was an auspicious sign for the Dharma.
Therefore, the construction was done to the utmost of worldly craftsmanship.
The golden treasure vase on top of the spire could hold twenty-five shi.
Below the treasure vase, there was a golden plate for catching dew.
It had eleven layers, and the circumference was all hung with golden bells.ğŸ”½There were also four iron chains leading the spire to the corners of the stupa.
On top of the chains at the four corners, there were also golden bells.
Their size was all like a stone jar.
The stupa had nine levels, and at each corner, golden bronze bells were hung.
In total, there were one hundred and thirty bells above and below.
On the four sides of the stupa, each had three gates and six windows.
They were all lacquered with vermilion.
On top of each gate, there were five rows of golden bells.
The twelve gates had twenty-four doors.
There are a total of 5,400 bells.
Below the bells, gold rings are engraved and spread out at the top.
Exhausting the cleverness of craftsmanship and reaching the limit of the skill in carpentry and masonry.
The people's children come and work day after day.
The Buddha's work is exquisite and inconceivable.
Embroidered pillars and golden decorations amaze the mind and eyes.
As for the autumn moon, the long night, and the high wind,
The precious bells harmonize and sound, and the voice and echo are in tune.
In the middle of the night, it shines brightly, illuminating the sky.
The sound of clanging is heard for more than ten li.
To the north of the stupa, there is a Buddha hall.
The shape is like the Taiji.
Inside there is a golden statue of the Buddha, 18 feet tall.
There are ten golden statues of the same size.
There are three pearl-stringed statues.
There are five golden-woven statues.
There are two jade statues.
The craftsmanship is extraordinary and surpasses the present age.
There are more than a thousand monks' rooms and pavilions.
The carved beams, white walls, green railings, and colorful lattices are difficult to describe.
The cypress, pine, and bamboo trees are lush and drip from the eaves.
The clumps of bamboo and fragrant herbs cover the steps and courtyard.
Therefore, Chang Jing wrote a stele for the temple, saying:
The Jetavana Garden and the Tuá¹£ita Pure Abode are unsurpassed.
The scriptures and images of the gods offered by foreign countries
are all in this temple.
The walls and courtyard of the temple
are all covered with tiles.
It looks like a palace wall.
The temple has four gates on each side.
The main southern gate has three layers of towers and three-story corridors.
It is twenty zhang above the ground.
Its design is similar to the current Duan Gate.
It is painted with cloud patterns and pictures of immortals and spirits.
The money and blue locks are brilliant and splendid.
On both sides of the gate are four strong men and four lions.
They are decorated with gold and silver and inlaid with pearls and jade.
The adornments are so dazzling that they have never been seen in the world.
The east and west gates are all the same.
The only difference is that the towers have two layers.
The northern gate has one road above, without a roof.
It resembles a crow-head gate.
Outside the four gates, all are planted with green locust trees, with green water running through.
Many travelers in the capital often take shelter under them.
The road is blocked by carriage covers.
It is not due to the moisture of lingering clouds.
The cool breeze sends coolness.
How can it rely on the blooming of the Acacia tree?
And the offerings are equal to those in Jetavana.
He provided the four necessities to seven hundred Indian monks.
Bodhiruci was the head translator of the scriptures.
The edict sent Li Ku to compile the scriptures.
Until Yongxi, the ruler moved to Guanzhong.
Thus forming the Western, Eastern, Southern, and Northern Wei Dynasties.
A total of sixteen emperors.
The world lasted one hundred and sixty-one years.ğŸ”½Split into the Zhou, Qi, Gao Yang, and Wu Chuan Zhen Lu.
Accepting the abdication of the Eastern Wei, he called himself Qi.
He immediately made Ye his capital.
He ruled three of the four rivers and five of the nine provinces.
Yang was truly intelligent, but his appearance seemed crazy.
He sent Daoists to shave his head.
Those who did not comply were eventually executed.
More than two hundred thousand monks.
Thirty thousand temples and stupas were destroyed.
The six rulers succeeded each other for twenty-eight years.
They were swallowed up by the Zhou.
The spiritual traces of the Three Jewels were all obliterated at the same time.
Chen Baxian was a man from Wuxing.
He took advantage of Hou Jing's overthrow of Jinling.
The Liang Prince of Xiangdong pacified Jingzhou and Chu.
Chu was annexed by Wei.
Xian then took Jiankang and made his surname the name of the state.
The four rulers lasted thirty-three years before the line ended.
In the ninth year of the Kaihuang era, the jiaxu year, the two polarities of the universe were unified again.
The king of the Qifu clan began in the twelfth year of the Taiyuan era of the Jin Dynasty's Emperor Xiaowu, when the stars were in the Xizi constellation.
Up to the Kaihuang year, it has been two hundred and three years.

In the Liang language, it means Dharma Abundance.
He brought the first part of the MahÄparinirvÄá¹‡a-sÅ«tra in ten fascicles, as well as the Bodhisattva Precepts, etc.
He arrived at Guzang and stayed at an inn.
Fearing that he would lose the scriptures, he used them as a pillow to sleep.
At night, someone pulled Dharmaraká¹£a to the ground.
He woke up in shock, thinking it was a thief.
This happened for three nights.
Then he heard a voice in the sky say:
This is the treasury of the TathÄgata's liberation.
Why do you use it as a pillow?
Xian was ashamed and enlightened.
He put it in a high place separately.
Sure enough, thieves tried to lift it up at night but could not bear its weight.
In the morning, Xian held it without thinking it heavy.
The thieves regarded him as a sage and all came to apologize.
At that time, Juqu Mengxun usurped the throne of Liang and called himself the King of Hexi.
He heard of Xian's virtuous reputation and summoned him to meet him.
After one meeting of conversation, he treated him with great courtesy.
He also invited him to propagate and translate.
The talented monk Huisong of Liangzhou personally received the brushwork.
Several hundred people from the west, both clergy and laity,
happily witnessed his bright abilities and asked questions freely.
Xian resolved their doubts and hesitations with clear eloquence like a flowing stream.
He also produced more than sixty thousand words of sutras, precepts, and other texts from the Jetavana Monastery.

Jingsheng, the Marquis of Anyang, was the cousin of Meng Xun.

In the twenty-third year of the Yuanjia era of Emperor Wen of the Liu Song Dynasty, the year of Bingxu.
It was the seventh year of the Taiping Zhenjun era of the Northern Wei Dynasty.
Emperor Taiwu of the Wei trusted the flattery and sycophancy of Cui Hao.
He revered Kou Qianzhi, calling him the Celestial Master.
He harmed the Buddhist order and destroyed Buddhist images.
Until the year of Gengyin.
Emperor Taiwu fell ill.
He then had a realization.
In addition, there was Chan Master Baizu who came to enlighten him.
He felt remorse.
He immediately executed Cui Hao.

Once, sitting by a well, the water in the washing jar was empty.
The disciples had not yet returned.
There was no one to draw water.
The Tripiá¹­aka master then took a willow branch and stirred the well mouth.
Silently reciting the mantra, he had just gone through it a few times.
The spring then gushed up to the level of the well's lip.
The Tripiá¹­aka master then used his alms bowl to scoop it up.
The monks beside him all praised it as a miracle.
The Dharma master said:
This is a magical method commonly practiced in foreign countries.
Since it is not practiced in this land, they say it is a miracle.
Fearing it will confuse the world,
I will henceforth keep it secret and not perform it.

The Record of Monasteries in Luoyang by Yang Xuanzhi in five fascicles, or in one large fascicle. The above one work is in five fascicles.
Compiled by Yang Xuanzhi, the Prefect of Qicheng County.
His preface states:
The records of the Three Ancient Tombs and Five Classics,
The words of the Nine Schools and Hundred Treatises,
All their principles lie within the human realm, and their meanings do not extend beyond the heavens.
As for the source of the One Vehicle and Two Truths, and the purport of the Six Supernatural Powers and Three Insights,
They are fully detailed in the Western Regions, but not recorded in the Eastern Land.
Since the recent dream of the sun, the full moon emits light,
The Yang Gate is adorned with the image of the eyebrows.
At night, they painted the image of the blue-haired one high on the wall.
Since then, the trend has spread widely.
By the Yongjia period of the Jin dynasty, there were only 42 temples.
The imperial Wei dynasty received the mandate and illuminated the capital at Songshan and Luoyang.
Faith became more abundant, and the Dharma teachings flourished even more.
Kings, nobles, and officials.
Abandoned elephants and horses like discarded shoes.
Commoners and wealthy families.
Donated wealth and property like old ruins.
Thus, monasteries were built side by side, and jeweled stupas were erected in rows.
Competing to depict the forms of the heavens.
Competing to imitate the shadows of the mountains.
The golden flagpole was as tall as the cloud terrace.
The lecture hall was as grand as the Afang Palace.
How could it be just wooden robes embroidered with brocade and earth covered with vermilion and purple?
By the Yongxi period, there were many difficulties, and the imperial capital moved to Ye.
The monks and nuns of various temples also moved with the times.
By the first year of the Wuding era.
I revisited Luoyang during my official duties.ğŸ”½The walls and houses collapsed, and brambles became a forest.
Wild animals made dens in the overgrown steps.
Mountain birds gather in the courtyard trees.
Playful children herd cattle.
They skip and jump on the nine roads.
Farmers plow the fields until old age.
They cultivate millet at the two gates.
Only then do I know that the inspiration of wheat sprouting is not unique to the ruins of Yin.
The sorrow of millet withering is indeed true in the Zhou palace.
In the capital city, inside and outside, there were more than a thousand temples in total.
Today, they are desolate and the sound of temple bells is rarely heard.
Fearing that future generations will have no record,
I thus compile this record.
However, there are too many temples to write about all of them.
What I record now are only the great monasteries.
Among them, for the auspicious and extraordinary worldly matters, I record them as well.
First, starting from within the city,
Next, including outside the city,
Listing the names of the gates to record the distances.
In total, there are five chapters.
My talent is not suitable for annotation, and there are many omissions.
Later gentlemen will examine its deficiencies.
